Recap: Olivia finds Emma's crib empty and finds out that Phillip has gone on vacation' with Emma. Alan goes to see Alex at the police station and tells her that the judge has denied her bail because she's a flight risk. Frank is asks a fellow police officer for help in finding Darcie as she's gone missing. Beth walks in on Gus leaving another message for Harley and tells him he should change his strategy, because the phone calls aren't working. Gus walks into the Beacon. Frank and Gus argue over what Gus did to Harley. Blake tells Ross how glad she is that they no longer have lies between them and how lucky she is to have him. Buzz tells Alex that he forgives her for getting trapped with Brad Green & getting caught up in everything. He then tells her he can't forgive her for hurting his kids, because no one hurts his kids. Buzz tells her to let Frank off the hook and to confess to setting Frank up. Alex is making a scene at the police station and when Ross tells her to shut up she tells him that she wants to make a deal. Harley tries explaining to Zach and Jude why Gus isn't going to be around when Gus shows up at the door.
Transcript: Alexandra: Oh, my god. Alan, thank god you're here. Oh, I can hardly wait to get out of here and go take a bath.
Alan: Um, alexandra, the judge has denied your bail.
Alexandra: I'm not going home?
Alan: Well, not today. I'm sorry, not today.
Alexandra: I can't stand it. Alan... alan, I didn't sleep a wink last night. I didn't sleep a wink and look at me. I'm an absolute mess.

Alan: Listen to me. You are too big of a flight risk right now for any judge to allow you to go back on those streets.

You stripped him of everything-- his job, his reputation, the woman he loves. You don't know what those kids had to sacrifice to get wherethey are today. They were knocked down all their lives. They only had each other to hang onto. But they kept on getting up. They got up. And they made it, and turned themselves into something, you know, better than anyone. And just when it looked like no one else could ever knock them down again, you came blowing in like a tornado and flattened them. You took their lives and...

Ross: Tell me again, would you? Why did I want this job?
Blake: To help make every springfielder's life more rewarding and prosperous.
